radiographic_examinations.findings: Mild atelectasis at the lung bases; no pleural or pericardial effusion. The liver, pancreas, and spleen are normal with no evidence of focal lesions. The gallbladder is surgically absent. The appendix is fluid-filled and dilated up to 12 mm, with surrounding fat stranding and inflammatory change extending to the base of the cecum; no extraluminal air or fluid collection. Hazy misty appearance in the mesentery most consistent with mesenteric panniculitis. Small fibroids in the uterus; no free fluid in the pelvis; no abdominal aortic aneurysm; mild atherosclerotic disease noted.
